text: A PRETTY YOUNG WOMAN is standing on the street corner wai for a bus. She's carrying books and looking very collegia A black stretch LIMOUSINE with darkened windows drives pa SLAMS ON ITS BRAKES, and backs up. The Young Woman stares her reflection in the windows, wondering what this is all about. Finally, the REAR PASSENGER WINDOW zips down, revealing L CHRISTMAS, age 30. He's a pleasant-enough looking guy, if little shaggy. He's wearing a dark suit.
Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the medical school? I'm supposed to be giving a lecture in twenty minutes and my driver's a bit lost.
(heavy European accent) Go straight aheads and makes a left over za bridge. Lloyd checks out her body.
I couldn't help noticing the accent. You from Jersey?
(unimpressed) Austria.
Austria? You're kidding. (mock-Australian accent) Well, g'day, mate. What do you say we get together later and throw a few shrimp on the barbie. The Young Woman turns her back to him and walks away.
(to self) Guess I won't be going Down Under tonight... He SIGHS and zips the window back up.
Lloyd climbs through the driver's partition into the fron seat. Then he puts a CHAUFFEUR'S CAP on his head and driv away. We see that HE'S THE DRIVER! The dispatch radio CRACKLES TO LIFE:
(v.o.) Carr 22, come in, car 22... Lloyd grabs his CB mike.
This is 22.
22, where the hell are you, Lloyd? You're running late on the East Side pick-up.
Cool your jets, Arnie. I'm on my way.
(v.o.) Well hurry it up. And make sure you park legally. One more ticket and your ass is history.

This building is white with black spots on it, like a DALMATION. Over the front door is an awning shaped like a DOG'S SNOUT, whiskers included. A van pulls up outside. The vehicle is decorated like a GIANT POODLE, with four l hanging off the sides, a tail in the rear, and a dog's sn on the front grill. MUTT CUTS is written on the side of i HARRY DUNNE climbs out. He's in his early 30s and dressed a ridiculous BEAGLE COSTUME, including a CAP WITH FLOPPY EARS. He goes to the rear of the van, opens it, and a swa of DOGS pile out.
Okay, gang, single file. You know the rules: No pushing, no humping, and no sniffing heinies...
The door to the shop opens and Harry's annoyed boss, MR. PALMER, sticks his head out.
Hey, why aren't those mutts on leashes?
The same reason you're not on a leash, sir because it's demeaning and it chafes like hell.

Just get them in here now! They all have to be bathed and clipped in an hour. Palmer disappears back inside. Harry CALLS to the dogs bu they pay no attention. He struggles to keep them from wandering off. He grabs a couple of SMALL POOCHES and sit them on a wall.
You kids stay right here... As he turns to round up the other, we discover that the w isn't a wall it's a flatbed truck. The truck drives away, taking the two dogs with it.
(at truck) Hey, wait a minute! Harry chases after the vehicle.

Lloyd Christmas pulls the limousine into a long, tree-lin driveway. He gets out and looks up in awe at an IMPRESSIV STONE MANSION. He WHISTLES to himself, then walks to the front oor and RINGS THE BELL. The double-front doors of the mansion open and MARY SWANS appears. She's 25 and gorgeous. Lloyd's jaw drops open wh he lays eyes on her.
Hello. (beat) I'll be just a minute...
As Mary steps back inside, Lloyd takes out a tiny can of Binaca. He sprays his mouth, under his arms, his hair, be his ears...

Lloyd is driving and Mary is in the back, looking out the window, lost in thought. She's got a BRIEFCASE resting on her lap and she fingers the leather nervously. Lloyd keep glancing at her in the rear-view mirror, but for a moment is speechless. Then:
Why you going to the airport? Flying somewhere?
(dead-pan) How'd you guess?
Well, I saw your luggage, then when I noticed the airline ticket, I put two and two together. (beat) So where you heading?
Aspen.
Oh, you're gonna love it. I hear California's beautiful this time of year. Mary looks back out the window and Lloyd sneaks another glance.
Name's Christmas. Lloyd Christmas.
I'm Mary. ON LLOYD - we can almost see his mind work. He's desperat to impress her.
Uh, this isn't my real job, you know. It's only temporary.
Oh?
Yeah, you see, my friend Harry and I are saving up our money so we can open our own pet store.
That's nice.
(smiling) I got worms.
I beg your pardon?

That's what we're gonna call it: I Got Worms. We're gonna specialize in selling worm farms you know, like ant farms. A lot of people don't realize that worms make much better pets than ants. They're quiet, affectionate, they don't bite, and they're super with the kids.
Aren't ants quiet, too? Lloyd realizes she has a point.
Uh... well, sure but they aren't half as affectionate. And if you cut an ant's head off, it won't grow back.
I see.

And best of all, worm farming is a seventy-five-thousand-dollar-a-year industry. I wouldn't mind having a piece of that pie, if you know what I mean. To her credit, she doesn't. They continue driving. Mary l at her watch and crosses her legs. Lloyd can see that she concerned about something.
What's the matter? Little tense about the flight?
(beat) Something like that. Lloyd SWIVELS AROUND and STARES over his shoulder at her.
It's really nothing to worry about, Mary. Statistically, they say you're more likely to get killed on the way to the airport. You know, like in a head-on crash, or something.
Um, Lloyd, could please keep your eyes on the road.
Good thinking. There's a lot of bad rivers out there. Lloyd turns back to the steering wheel.
Lloyd is putting the last bags on a cart. He closes the t and turns to Mary. She looks nervous and disconcerted as reaches into her purse. She pulls out a ten-dollar tip.
Here you go.
Keep it. It was my pleasure. For the first time, Mary Swanson offers a slight smile. T makes her more lovely than ever.
Relax, Mary. Just get trashed and pass out. You'll be there before you know it.
Thanks Lloyd. (beat) And good luck with your worms.

Then she PICKS UP HER BRIEFCASE and walks into the termin followed by a PORTER pushing her bags. Lloyd watches her, ENCHANTED, until she's out of sight. Afterwards, he climbs back into the limo,  LOVESICK. For moment he doesn't even have the energy to  turn the key. just drops his head against the steering  wheel, DEVASTAT There's a TAP on the window. Lloyd looks  up to see a POL OFFICER standing there.
Come on, move it, you're in a red zone. Lloyd starts the limo and pulls away.

Mary looks tense as she moves through the throngs of travelers. Her pace is slow, deliberate, and her eyes are focused straight ahead. She passes a row of phone botths and two MEN one dressed an ARMANI SUIT, the other in a PLAID SPORTCOAT watch her.
She's gonna leave the briefcase at the foot of the escalator. You make the pick-up.
Piece of cake.

As Lloyd pulls his limo slowly away, he glances in the ai window and SEES MARY WALKING ALONG. When she stops at the foot of the escalator, he stops, to She puts down the briefcase and checks her coat pocket fo her ticket. Lloyd's attention is distracted by a HONK. He turns to see a car irectly behind him.

(to car's driver) Drive around me, you pinhead! When he turns back to watch Mary in the terminal he sees that SHE'S GONE, and she's LEFT HER BRIEFCASE AT THE FOOT THE STAIRS. Lloyd jumps to ATTENTION.

He pulls the car into a HANDICAPPED SPOT and hops out. He starts to run into the terminal, then notices the Police Officer and suddenly goes into a spastic walk, limping an dragging him leg behind him like a palsy victim.

The Armani Man nods to the Plaid Sportcoat and he starts approach the briefcase. Just as Plaid Sportcoat is reachi for the handle, LLOYD RUNS BY AND GRABS IT. He CONTINUES THE ESCALATOR three steps at a time. The two men look at each other, dumbstruck.
Lloyd runs with the briefcase to the TV monitors that pos the departure times. He looks frantically at the confusio of numbers.
Damn! QUICK CUT of a dejected Lloyd looking out the window as h watches as Mary's airplane taxiing away.

Lloyd comes out with the briefcase, passing the two men, FOLLOW HIM AT A DISTANCE. He starts walking down the side when suddenly he STOPS IN HIS TRACKS. HIS POV - his limo is being towed away    under the super of the Police Officer. He takes off after it, but to no avail.
You can't do this! I'll lose my job! As Lloyd watches the limo get towed out of site, he runs fingers through his hair.

We see the Mutt Cuts van pull up and park at the curb. A dejected Harry climbs out. At the same time, a taxi pulls and drops off Lloyd. (He's clutching Mary Swanson's briefcase.) Both he and Harry climb the steps of the buil They disappear inside without acknowledging each other.
ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE STREET - a black Cadillac pulls and parks. Inside are the Armani suit and the Sportcoat. They are J.P. SHAY and JOSEPH MENTALINO (aka JOE MENTAL).
Who the hell do you figure this guy's working for?
I don't know, but we'd better find out... Mental takes some PILLS and starts CHOMPING them.
Your ulcer?
It ain't gonna kill me.
Lloyd and Harry trudge up the stairs and proceed silently toward the door of their apartment.

Lloyd and Harry ENTER and   pass each other quietly as th both plunk down in their   favorite easy chairs. (Lloyd s has the briefcase in his   lap.) Harry's caged parakeet, tweets hello, but the two   guys just sit there SILENTLY. The place is a mess. Wallpaper's peeling off the walls. T carpet is threadbare and filthy. In the corner we see a miniature WORM FARM and a large terrarium filled with dir and worms. Here are a couple pieces of haggard furniture with stuffing spilling out of the gashes.
I got fired again. Lloyd shakes his head.
I don't mean to be harsh, Harry, but let's face it, you are one pathetic loser. No offense.
None taken. Were you shitcanned, too?
Of course not. (beat) I quit.
Why'd you quit?
I had a hunch Arnie was gonna fire me.
Why didn't you wait and see if your suspicions were well-founded?
Winners control their own destiny, Har. Lloyd fetches a couple beers from the fridge and throws o to him.
You know, the thing that really chaps my ass is that I just spent my life savings turning my van into a poodle. (beat) The alarm alone cost me two hundred.
Big deal. That car's an old bomb anyway.
What are you talking about? It's only six years old.
That's forty-two in dog years. They open their beers and drink simultaneously. Then Harr notices the briefcase.
What's with the briefcase?
It's a love memento.
Huh?

The most beautiful woman alive. Her name was Mary. I drove her to the airport. Sparks flew, emotions ran high, breasts heaved. She left this case in the terminal and flew to Aspen and out of my life. End of story.
What's in it?
DO you really expect me to go snooping around in someone else's private property?
Why not?

(beat) It's locked. They take another sip of their beers. Suddenly we hear a LOUD KNOCK at the door. Petey the parakeet starts to SQUA The guys look at each other, ALARMED, then Harry tip-toes the PEEPHOLE. HARRY'S POV - a DISTORTED-LOOKING J.P. Shay and Joe Menta are standing at the door.
(WHISPERING to Harry) Friend or foe?
(WHISPERING)
We don't have any friends. Harry is still squinting out the peephole.
Can't recognize them. Could be student loan thugs again, or the IRS, or maybe somebody pissed off about that case of Girl Scout cookies you bounced a check on.
Hey, I ordered Mystic Mint. The little swindlers gave me Peanut Butter Praline.
Well, whoever they are, they look serious. One of them's even wearing plaid.
(cringing) That's a hostile pattern. I say we bail and get down to unemployment. Lloyd GRABS THE BRIEFCASE and the two of them EXIT out th window and down the fire escape.
The poodle van pulls up to the curb in front of the build and PARKS NEXT TO A FIRE HYDRANT. Lloyd and Harry climb o Lloyd takes a trash can and places it OVER THE HYDRANT, COVERING IT COMPLETELY.
STANLEY GRABNER is small, plump, balding, not a lot of la

Gentlemen, I'm delighted to say that neither I nor the unemployment epartment of the state of Rhose Island can do anything for you. (beat) You've run out of chances. You're unemployable. Remember last year? Middle of winter I busted my butt to

head_text.subj: GET YOU BOTH PRIME JOBS. TWELVE-

text: fifty an hour, and you went and blew it!
Blew it? For your information, we only missed three days in two months.
Yeah, and that was because of a blizzard
(exploding)
Grabner falls back in his chair, exhausted.
Come on, Stan. I'm sure you can find something else for us. How about another crack at that Suicide Hotline? Grabner jumps up.
J.P. Shay is looking through Harry and Lloyd's kitchen cupboards as Joe Mental comes out of the bedroom.
The briefcase ain't here. He must've taken it with him.
Shit. (beat) Well he's gotta come home sometime. Joe Mental ominously approaches Petey the parakeet's cage
Maybe we should leave him a little message to let 'em know we're playing hardball. Mental opens the cage door and wraps his meaty fist aroun the bird, who SCREECHES IN TERROR.
(a la Tweety Bird) I taut I taw a puddy cat. Mental smiles, and as we PAN to J.P. Shay, we hear a bone chilling O.S. SNAP and Petey the bird stops SQUAWKING.
(still Tweety) I did, I did...
The Mutt Cuts van pulls up to the curb. A depressed Lloyd and Harry climb out and mope up to their apartment buildi entrance.
Give me what's left of our dough. I'll go to the corner and buy a few necessities. Harry hands his friend some crumpled bills.
What's cheaper, Thunderbird or Night Train?
Get Robitussin it's a better buzz.

Lloyd comes out of the store with his arms full of grocer He stops at a newspaper machine, pulls out his WALLET and removes a quarter. He drops the quarter in the machine, opens it, and realiz that he DOESN'T HAVE A FREE HAND to pick up the newspaper He puts his wallet inside the machine, picks up the newsp and as he does so THE MACHINE SLAMS SHUT WITH HIS WALLET STILL INSIDE. Lloyd SIGHS, puts his grocery bags on the machine, and ch his pockets. NO MORE CHANGE. Just then, an ELDERLY WOMAN struggles by using a WALKER.
Excuse me, little old lady, do you have change for a dollar?
Change? No, I'm sorry, I don't...
Well could you do me a favor and guard this while I go break a dollar? My wallet's locked in this machine.

Of course, young man... Lloyd runs back into the store. We HOLD ON THE STORE DOOR Lloyd EXITS a few seconds later with a handful of quarter Suddenly he stops in his tracks. The ELDERLY LADY, HER WA AND HIS GROCERIES ARE GONE. As he takes a closer look, he sees that SHE HAS TAKEN HIS WALLET ALSO.
A thoroughly beleaguered Lloyd is trudging empty-handed u the steps to his apartment.
The door opens and Lloyd ENTERS. Harry is sitting on the couch, looking almost comatose.
Where's the booze?
It's gone. I got robbed by Grandma Walton. She got my wallet, too. Harry drops his head and lets out a MOAN.
Come on, man, cheer up. We've been own before. I'm sure we'll land on our heads somewhere.
It gets worse, Lloyd. My parakeet Petey he's... he's dead. Lloyd looks touched by this.
Oh man, I'm sorry, Harry. What happened?
His head fell off.
His head fell off?
Yeah, he was pretty old. Lloyd puts his hand on Harry's shoulder compassionately.
(hopeful) I don't suppose he had a warranty...?
Nah, I bought him used. As Lloyd thinks about the unfairness of life, he grows up
That's it! I've had it with this ump! We don't have food, we don't have jobs, our pets' heads are falling off, we're surrounded by roving gangs of larcenous old LADIES...
Okay, calm down.
No I won't calm down. Lloyd flops down in a chair.
What the hell are we doing here anyway, Harry? We've got to get out of this town.
Yeah, and go where?
I'll tell you where: someplace warm, a place where the beer flows like wine, where beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. (dramatic PAUSE) I'm talking about Aspen.
Aspen?
That's right, Aspen.
I don't know, Lloyd, the French are assholes.

Let me ask you something: do you want to end up like Petey dead in some flea-ridden apartment, face- down on a Dear Abby column, with a soggy sunflower seed pressed against your beak? Or do you want to enjoy your life? (beat) Come on, Harry, don't let Petey's eath be in vain. Don't you see what he was saying? Spread your wings, man. he was saying? Spread your wings, man. Fly.

(confused) What are you talking about, Lloyd? His head fell off. (dawning realization) Wait a second, I know what you're up to. You just wanna go to Aspen so you can find that girl who lost her briefcase and you need me to drive you there.
That's bullshit. I'll drive. (beat) And what's so wrong about going someplace where we know someone who can plug us into the social pipeline?

(torn) I don't know, Lloyd. I think we should stay here, hunt for jobs, and keep saving money for the worm store. I'm getting a little sick and tired of always running from creditors. Lloyd moves to the window and looks out at the gray, wint cityscape.
You know what I'm sick and tired of, Harry? I'm sick and tired of having to eek my way through life. I'm sick and tired of being a nobody.
(beat) But most of all, I'm sick and tired of having nobody. There's a deadly SILENCE as they both think about this. T Harry tries to lighten the mood. He opens his arms wide.
Come on, Lloyd. Give us a kiss.

On the other hand, maybe you're right, Harry. Maybe we should stay here and try our luck in bankruptcy court. With all those lawsuits against us, I'm sure we'll win at least one. It could be a boost to our egos. Harry sees that Lloyd has a point. He stands and approach Petey's cage. His eyes fill with tears.
(emotional) Petey, I made a promise to you once, man... (thinking hard) ...and I'll be damned if I can remember what it was.
The Mutt Cutts van is going down the highway while Danny Wilson's "Mary's Prayer" plays on the soundtrack. The van drives past and we HOLD ON a sign that reads: "YOU ARE LE

head_text.subj: PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND. COME BACK SOON." VARIOUS OTHER

text: SHOTS of the car travelling down the road while the song continues to play.
Harry's behind the wheel and Lloyd's in the passenger sea The Animal's "We've Got to Get Out of This Place" is BLAS on the radio and the guys are SINGING ALONG:
"We've got to get out of this place, If it's the last thing we ever do, We've got to get out of this place, Girl, there's a better life, for me and you..." Lloyd turns down the radio.
Well, we're finally doing it. Do you realize that in all the years we've known each other, this is the first time we've done this together.
Been run out of town?
Taken a trip. Harry reaches over and UNDOES HIS SEATBELT. Lloyd watches curious.
Why'd you do that?
What?
Take your seatbelt off.
Because we just cleared the danger zone.
Huh?
Don't you know anything, Lloyd? Ninety percent of all accidents happen within five miles of home. We've already traveled 6.3 miles.
Well what about the people who live around here? What if we got into an accident with one of them?
Harry considers this, then sheepishly puts his seatbelt b on. Lloyd opens a bag of Doritos and fiddles with the rad
Where'd you get those?
Bought 'em when we filled up.
Lloyd, I thought we agreed to confer on all expenditures. We're on a tight budget, remember?
This didn't come out of our travel fund. I was able to scrape up twenty- five bucks before we left. You know, so we could live in style.
Where'd you get twenty-five extra bucks?
I sold some stuff to Billy in 4-C.
You mean the blind kid?
That's right. Lloyd looks out the window guiltily.
What did you sell him, Lloyd?
Just some odds and ends.
Specifically?
Oh, a few baseball cards, a sack of marbles, Petey, three comic books a second, are you telling me you sold my dead bird to a blind kid? Well who else was I gonna sell it to?
But Lloyd, Petey didn't even have a head.
Put your mind at ease, friend. I took care of it.

At the bottom of the stairs leading up to the building is little blind boy, BILLY. He sits in a wheelchair playing with a PARAKEET WHOSE HEAD IS SCOTCH-TAPED ON. He throws ead bird up, but it flops into his lap.
Fly! Joe Mental and J.P. Shay approach and climb the steps.
CLOSE ON A NOTE - taped to Harry and Lloyd's apartment do It reads: TO ALL OUR
PULLBACK to reveal Joe Mental and J.P. Shay.
Those bastards. They're rubbing it right in our faces.
Shit! Andre will have a goddamn aneurysm if we don't get that briefcase back.
Don't   worry, we'll get it back. And I'll   tell you something else. They ain't   gonna reach Aspen, either. I'll   make sure of that. Mental takes out more ANTACID PILLS and starts to chew on them.
A pissed-off Shay and Mental EXIT the building. Mental po more antacid pills into his mouth as they descend the sta Little Billy is still tossing the lifeless parakeet into air.
Come on, boy, fly! Plop. Then Billy hears Shay and Mental on the steps and C
Excuse me, mister. Is there something wrong with my bird? Mental picks up the bird, studies it, then angrily and WI IT DOWN THE STREET as hard as he can.
Don't worry, Ironside, he just flew south for the winter.
Harry is still driving while Lloyd studies a map spread o before him.
How far have we gone?
According to this map, about an inch and a half.
Shit. We're gonna need a smaller map or we'll never get there. We don't have enough gas money.
Relax. We have more than enough.
I believe you're wrong, Lloyd.
And I believe I'm right, Harry.
I still say wrong, Lloyd.
How much you wanna bet?
I don't bet.
Lloyd looks at his friend, incredulous.
What do you mean you don't bet?
I mean I don't gamble, you know that. Never have and never will.
Oh, bull. I'll bet you our next meal that I can get you gambling before the day's out.
There's no way, Lloyd. You can't do it.
I'll give you three-to-one odds. That's three feedbags if you win, against only one if you lose.
You're wasting your money, Lloyd. I already told you, I don't gamble.
Okay, five-to-one I can get you gambling before the day's out.
Sorry, pal, no way.
Make it ten-to-one. Harry sticks out his hand.
You got yourself a bet, sucker! As Harry SHAKES LLOYD'S HAND, Lloyd breaks into a BIG SMI Harry immediately realizes he's been had.
The Mutt Cutt van is sandwiched between mountainous tract trailer trucks.

Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a booth, surrounded by tab of tough-looking TRUCKERS. Harry oesn't look happy. A mid aged, no-nonsense WAITRESS approaches their table with a couple of burgers and drinks. She puts them down in front the boys and starts to walk away.
(to Waitress)
The Waitress reluctantly returns to the table.
What's the soup du jour?
It's the soup-of-the-day.
Sounds tasty. I'll have a bowl.
(sarcastic) Anything else before I leave the area?
Actually, this chocolate milk isn't mixed very well. Could you please bring me a spoon? The Waitress SIGHS and picks up the milk. Then she BLOWS
There. Now you don't need one. The guys watch her stomp away.

head_text.subj: FEELS GOOD TO MINGLE WITH THESE LAID-

text: back country-folk, don't it, Harry? Harry wipes off his straw with a napkin. As he moves to p it in the ashtray, he accidentally KNOCKS OVER THE SALT SHAKER.
LLOYD
Uh-oh... HARRY
What's the matter? LLOYD
You spilled the salt. That's bad luck. We're driving across the country and the last thing we need is bad luck. Quick, toss a handful of salt over your right shoulder. HARRY
What for? LLOYD
Because that's good luck. Harry shrugs, shakes some salt into his palm, and flings over his shoulder. Suddenly they hear a YELP. MALE VOICE
(o.s.) What the fuck?! LLOYD
Or was it the left shoulder? They turn and see a burly TRUCKER wiping salt out of his eyes. TRUCKER
Who's the dead man threw shit in my eye? The huge Trucker stands and squints at Lloyd and Harry. H wearing a FOAM BASEBALL CAP that says: WINE 'EM, DINE 'EM SIXTY-NINE 'EM. HARRY

It was a terrible accident, Sir. Believe me, I would never do anything to offend a man of your size. Please accept my most sincere apology. The Trucker GROWLS and approaches the table, egged on by equally burly FRIENDS. BURLY FRIEND #1
Teach him a lesson, Sea Bass!
Sea Bass glares down at Harry's hamburger. SEA BASS
You gonna eat that?
Um... the thought had crossed my mind. At this, Sea Bass leans over and DROPS A BIG, BROWN WAD O
SEA BASS
Still want it? Harry stares at the burger non-commitally. HARRY
Nah, you go ahead. Sea Bass picks up the burger and walks back to his table, the LAUGHTER of his friends.
J.P. Shay is at the gas pump filling the black Cadillac w Joe Mental stretches his legs. A large truck pulls away, REVEALING THE PREVIOUSLY HIDDEN MUTT CUTTS VAN. Mental sm at this, and we
The Waitress drops the check on Lloyd and Harry's table a STOMPS away. Harry studies the bill and SIGHS. HARRY
Perfect. I'm out eight bucks and I still haven't eaten. LLOYD

Well if you'd stop picking fights with the locals... (brightening) Wait a second. I think I just had an idea. Follow me... Lloyd stands and walks over to Sea Bass and his pals. A nervous Harry trails after him.
LLOYD (CONT'D)
Excuse me, gentlemen, I'd just like to apologize for that unpleasant scene a little earlier. SEA BASS
Huh? LLOYD

What I'm trying to say is, my friend and I would like to buy you guys a round of beers, just to bury the hatchet. Harry stares at Lloyd like he's out of his mind, but the Truckers seem to like the idea. SEA BASS
Make it four boiler-makers. LLOYD
Whatever you want, sir. I'll have the waitress send them over. Oh, and fellas hope to see you again down the road. Lloyd and Harry move away from the table toward the CASHI HARRY
Lloyd, what are you doing? You know we can't afford to buy them drinks. Lloyd hands the Cashier their check. LLOYD
Um, Sea Bass and the fellas offered to pick up our check. They said just add this to their tab. CASHIER
(skeptical) Sea Bass said that? LLOYD
Well, if that guy at the table over there is Sea Bass... He points across the room to Sea Bass and company. Sea Ba

head_text.subj: NODS TO THE CASHIER AND GESTURES TO HIS TABLE, NOT WANTIN

text: TO MISS OUT ON HIS FREE DRINK. The Cashier is convinced. CASHIER
Okey-dokey, if that's what he wants...
Harry smiles at this. He grabs a couple Beef Jerky's, a c bar, and a copy of The National Enquirer off the counter. HARRY
Oh, and put these on there, too.
You got it. LLOYD
(to Cashier) By the way, how far is it to Rhode Island from here?
The front door BURSTS OPEN and a red-faced Sea Bass STORM OUT, followed by his buddies, the Cashier, and the Waitre SEA BASS
I'm gonna kill those sons-of-bitches! CASHIER
Hurry and you'll catch 'em. They was on their way to Rhode Island. The Truckers jump in their rigs and RUMBLE AWAY   in the OPPOSITE DIRECTION our boys are headed.
The Mutt Cutts van breezes by.
A jubilant Harry's driving and chewing on a mouthful of B Jerky. LLOYD
I just wish we could've seen Sea Bass's face when he got the bill. HARRY
I hope we never have to. LLOYD
Don't worry. That fish-head is probably half-way to Providence by now.
HARRY
I hope so. Harry checks his rear-view mirror nervously. LLOYD
Hey, stop the car. I gotta take a whiz. HARRY
Are you crazy? I'm not stopping now. What if they figure out we went the other way. They'll be on us in no time. LLOYD
But I gotta go. What am I supposed to do? HARRY
Hold it. LLOYD
I can't hold it. I'm about to explode.
Well... just take a whiz in an empty beer bottle. There's a couple on the floor in the back seat. LLOYD
Are you serious? HARRY
Yes, I'm serious. I'm not stopping now. We could get killed. Lloyd SIGHS. He takes an EMPTY BEER BOTTLE from the back seat and UNZIPS his fly. Suddenly we hear a PEEING SOUND. Then: LLOYD
Uh-oh... HARRY
What's the matter? LLOYD
The bottle's almost full and I'm still going. HARRY
Well stop going.
LLOYD
I can't stop once I already started, you know that. Quick, get me another bottle. Harry can BARELY HOLD THE STEERING WHEEL as he reaches wa in the back seat for an empty. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Jesus, be careful! You almost went off the road. HARRY
I'm sorry, Lloyd. I'm doing the best I can. He hands Lloyd another empty and Lloyd quickly makes the switch. LLOYD
Here, hold this. Before Harry knows it he's holding the full BOTTLE OF URI
As the Mutt Cutts van travels down the highway, it passes STATE TROOPER on a motorcycle hidden in the bushes. The Trooper takes off after them.
Harry is doing his best to steer while now holding FIVE F BOTTLES AND Lloyd is still going at it in the passenger s HARRY
What are you, a goddamn camel? LLOYD
Hey, I haven't gone all day. Just then they hear a LOUDSPEAKER: STATE TROOPER
(o.s.) Pull over! They turn to see the POLICE MOTORCYCLE cruising right bes then. Harry rolls down his window and CALLS OUT: HARRY
Huh?
STATE TROOPER
Harry glances down at his sweater he's wearing, then back the Trooper. HARRY
(calling out) No, it's a Cardigan! But thanks for noticing! He rolls his window back up and turns to an equally baffl Lloyd. HARRY (CONT'D)
Jesus, what is this, the fashion police? The Cop turns on his SIREN. STATE TROOPER

head_text.subj: PULL YOUR CAR TO THE SIDE OF THE

text: The STATE TROOPER is walking up beside the stopped Mutt C van, staring at it with isapproval. STATE TROOPER
License and registration, please. Harry hands him the papers. STATE TROOPER (CONT'D)
You know, you fellas were all over the road back there. HARRY
Yes, sir, we had a little... ifficulty in the car. STATE TROOPER
Uh-huh. (beat) Have you boys been doing a little rinking maybe? HARRY
No, sir.
STATE TROOPER
Then what's that? He points to the OPEN, FULL BEER BOTTLES hidden in the se between them. HARRY
Oh, that's nothing, sir. STATE TROOPER
Do you know it's against the law to rive with an open alcohol container in this state? LLOYD
But, your honor, he's telling the truth. It's not beer. The officer smirks. STATE TROOPER
Is that right? The Trooper reaches in and picks up one of the bottles. H inspects the beer label, then MOVES THE BOTTLE TO HIS LIPS. HARRY
Sir, I wouldn't TROOPER --You'd keep your mouth shut if you knew what was good for you. LLOYD
(under breath) YOU WOULD, TOO... Harry shoots Lloyd a look as the Trooper begins GULPING d the piss. He pauses uncertainly and a SICK LOOK COMES OVE HIS FACE. He takes a DEEP BREATH. Then:
(pained) Get the hell out of here.
The Mutt Cutts van is pulling back onto the highway while the officer remains in the breakdown lane with his hands his knees.
The van is making steady progress through the dark night.
Lloyd is driving now while Harry sleeps in the passenger seat. The song, "Cut Flowers" by The Smithereens, starts play as Lloyd FANTASIZES about his future in Aspen.

Lloyd is walking up the steps of a luxurious, snow-covere chalet, carrying Mary's briefcase. The sky is absurdly bl and children are making a snowman on the lawn. It's all o of a dream world. He KNOCKS on the door, tentatively. Mar opens it. She looks at him, then at the briefcase, and br into the BIGGEST, SWEETEST SMILE he's ever seen. Then she slowly backs into the house, gesturing for him to follow. Lloyd follows Mary down a hallway. As he trails after her she pulls off her shirt, revealing her bare back, and gla over her shoulder at him. CAMERA MOVES around a corner and now we're in a STEAMY BATHROOM. The shower is running and we see the silhouette two people behind the curtain.
How does that feel, Lloyd?
CLOSE ON LLOYD - we see he's taking the TEGRIN CHALLENGE, with different shampoos on either side of his head and a noticeable part down the middle.
How's the other side?
Nothing. Nothing at all.

(o.s.) Lloyd, will you wash my nipples...? ON MARY - her   hair is slicked back, making her look bet than ever. As   the CAMERA PANS DOWN toward her breasts, are surprised   to see not breasts but a SET OF HEADLIGHT SUPERIMPOSED   OVER HER CHEST AREA. The headlights FLASH Then TWICE. ON LLOYD - he blinks, confused at what's happening. JUMP CUT   TO - an eighteen-wheeler is ROARING RIGHT TOWA THE MUTT   CUTTS VAN on the highway. Lloyd quickly veers into his   lane and avoids tragedy by a whisker. A shaken lets out   a SIGH OF RELIEF, and we
The Mutt Cutts van is parked outside this seedy establish A neon sign blinks: GROUP DISCOUNTS - HAVE YOUR NEXT AFFAIR HERE.
(v.o.) I don't know, Lloyd, I feel a little sleazy staying here when we're not even engaged.
(v.o.) Hey, it's the only motel that charges by the hour. We can't afford anything else.
Lloyd and Harry are sitting in a large, HEART-SHAPED JACU Lloyd is sipping a beer and Harry is absorbed in the Enqu as the water swirls around them.
Yep, this sure is the life. Cold beer, a hot tube, and fuzzy pink sheets... You know, there's only one thing that could make this moment any better.
What's that? LLOYD
If you had a nice set of knockers. HARRY
That's two things, Lloyd. LLOYD
Right now I'd settle for one. Lloyd takes a swig of beer. Harry puts down the paper and looks around at the romantic decor. HARRY
I don't know, Lloyd, these places just don't do it for me. Brings back too many memories. LLOYD
What happened, Harry? Some little filly break your heart? HARRY
Nah, it was a girl. Fraida Felcher. We stayed at a place like this once No-Tell Motel out on Route 31. LLOYD
Felcher? You mean the babe who worked for the tractor company? Harry nods. HARRY
The same. We had this incredibly romantic time. Boy, I thought we'd be together forever. (SIGHS)
Then about a week later, right out of the blue, she sends me a John Deere letter. LLOYD
That's cold, Har. Give you any reason? HARRY
I called her up and she gave me some crap about me not listening to her enough or something like that. I wasn't really paying attention.
Harry reaches for a beer and busts it open. He takes a bi gulp. HARRY (CONT'D)
Thing that really hurts is I think she was seeing another guy. Never id find out who. ON LLOYD - he does his best to hide his GUILT.

We see that the black Cadillac is   parked a few cars ove from the Mutt Cutts van with J.P.   Shay in the passenger PAN OVER to a payphone. Inside is   Joe Mental. Outside t booth, an ANXIOUS MAN impatiently   paces back and forth waits for the phone. MENTAL
(into phone) The boys are holed-up in a little love nest for the night. I think they're a couple of fucking weirdos.
NICHOLAS ANDRE is pacing around the room with a cordless phone. He's in his late 30s, wears a ponytail, and dresse in Aspen/Rodeo Drive chic. ANDRE
What in hell are those guys up to? Is it possible that they're Feds?
MENTAL
Unlikely from what I've seen. The ANXIOUS MAN taps on the phone booth and motions for M to hang up. ANDRE

I don't like this one goddamn bit, Mental. You and Shay were supposed to grab that bag so we could end this shit. Now I don't know what the hell's going on. Andre SIGHS and wipes some perspiration from his upper li The Anxious Man KNOCKS on the booth again.
MENTAL

Hold on a second, Mr. Andre... Mental puts the phone down and motions the    Anxious Man to the booth. The Man moves forward a few    inches. Ment motions him even closer. When he's about a    foot away, punches his hand through the glass of the    booth and kn the Anxious Man out cold. Then Mental picks up the phone again. MENTAL (CONT'D)
Sorry, boss. You were saying...? ANDRE
Look, Mental, just find out what they're up to. I want to know who these guys are. MENTAL

Don't worry. I'm on it. Mental hangs up the phone, looks around to make sure he's not being watched, then approaches the parked Mutt Cutt v He's joined by J.P. Shay. As they get within five feet of the vehicle, we hear a LO GROWL. They stop in their tracks and turn, expecting to s a dog but there isn't one. They both take another step forward, and the GROWL GETS LOUDER AND MEANER. Again, Men and Shay stop. He peeks under the car. Nothing. SHAY

What the fuck...? Finally, Shay reaches for the door handle. As soon as he touches it, though, the car alarm goes off but instead of siren, it's the incredibly annoying sound of a POODLE YAP Mental jumps back and pulls his gun. MENTAL
Where's the goddamn dog? Shay shrugs, nervous. The YAPPING grows EVEN LOUDER now, forcing a flustered Shay and Mental to retreat from the s
ESTABLISHING SHOT of a luxurious mountainside home.
An agitated Mary Swanson (the young woman who lost her briefcase) is pacing back and forth in

head_text.subj: AN IMPRESSIVE, ANTIQUE-FILLED LIVING ROOM. SEATED ON A CO
ARE HER FATHER KARL AND HIS MUCH-

text: younger second wife, HELEN. MARY
It just doesn't make any sense. I left the money exactly where they instructed me to. HELEN
Actually, it makes a great deal of sense, Mary. We should have called in the authorities the moment we knew Melvin had been kidnapped. KARL
Now, Helen, we've been through this already for Christ's sake, Karl, these bastards will extort us into bankruptcy if we let them. MARY
But I'd never forgive myself if something happened to Melvin. KARL
Stop upsetting my daughter, Helen. She's been through quite enough already. MARY
It's not her fault, Daddy. We're all a little on edge. Just then the living room door opens and the pony tailed Nicholas Andre ENTERS. He looks appropriately solemn. ANDRE
Has there been any word, Mr. Swanson? KARL
Nothing yet, Nicholas. Andre looks upset. ANDRE
Perhaps I should call off the Preservation benefit this weekend.

head_text.subj: IT WOULD BE EASY ENOUGH TO RE-

text: schedule.
No, Nicholas, it's imperative that we carry on as usual. The atmosphere in the room couldn't be more somber. Karl Swanson holds his hand out to his aughter.
Don't worry, sweetheart. I'll do everything they ask. Nothing's going to happen to Melvin, I promise you.
Thank you, Daddy. Karl Swanson looks out the window, concerned.
The black Cadillac pulls over to the side of the road. Jo Mental gets out of the car and props the hood open. He ta out his gun, SLIDES IN A NEW CLIP, and puts it back in hi pocket.
(to Shay) Lie down on the front seat. After they pick me up I want you to follow us. Then he folds his arms and the two killers wait for the v to come along.
Lloyd taps Harry's shoulder.
You're it. Harry taps Lloyd back.
You're it. Lloyd immediately taps Harry.
LLOYD
You're it. Quitsies. HARRY
(tapping him back) Anti-quitsies. You're it. Quitsies. No anti-quitsies. No startsies. Lloyd shakes his head, defeated. LLOYD
Damn, you're good, Harry. (beat) Hey, didn't I tell you this trip would be a blast?
Joe Mental squints down the road, sees the Mutt Cutts van approaching, and starts WAVING HIS HANDS to flag them dow

Through the windshield we can see Mental waving. The guys don't slow down, through. The just WAVE BACK as they BLOW RIGHT BY HIM. Harry also toots the horn, which makes the SOUND OF A DOG BARKING. LLOYD
See, I told you these country folks were friendly, Harry.
As an angry Mental watches them disappear down the road, Shay sits up in the front seat. SHAY
What happened? MENTAL
These fuckers are really pissing me off now.
We hear The Zombie's 'Time of the Season' as the van flas by.
HARRY
Refresh my memory on something, Lloyd: what exactly do we do when we get to Aspen? LLOYD
Well the first thing we do is take a good deep breath of that famous Aspenese air.
Fresh, huh? LLOYD
The freshest. They say on any day of the week you can smell a moose-fart ten miles away.
(sincere) Wow... talk about paradise. (beat) And after we're finished breathing, what next, Lloyd? LLOYD
Then we make a splash on the social scene. Just then, Lloyd notices something up the road. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Harry, look the golden arches. Pull over, I'm starving.
The Mutt Cutt car is at the drive-through window.
...That's two cheese burgers, two fries, and two medium Cokes. Five seventy- two. Harry hands a ten-dollar-bill to the Employee, who return handful of change.
Thanks.

Then, before he can  give them   the bag of food, the guy absentmindedly DRIVE  OFF. As   they pull out of the park lot, the McDonald's  Employee   sticks his head out the w and WAVES THE BAG OF  FOOD at   them. MCDONALD'S EMPLOYEE
Hey! But the guys are already around the corner.
The Mutt Cutt van is on the road again, cruising along.
HARRY
About this social scene how do you expect a couple mutts like us to make a splash in the land of pedigrees when we don't even have any money? LLOYD
Look, once we drop the briefcase off to Mary, she'll be so grateful she'll plug us right into the party circuit. After that, we do a little of the ski
rubbers, and walk out of there in the spring with enough business connections to open a first-class worm operation You see, you don't get rich working, Harry. You get rich knowing the rich. HARRY
Where'd you hear that? LLOYD
Some bum down at unemployment. Harry thinks about this. HARRY
I don't know, Lloyd. LLOYD
What's the matter? HARRY
Money does terrible things to people. I mean, we could lose our friendship.
Lloyd thinks about this.
Yeah? So? Harry nods and looks out the window. Suddenly SOMETHING D ON LLOYD. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Hey, wait a second. Hold everything.
What? LLOYD
Aren't you forgetting something? Harry thinks about this. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Back at Mickey D's? A little matter you might've overlooked...? Harry wracks his brain, but to no avail.
What? Lloyd rolls his eyes.
My change. As a sheepish Harry gives Lloyd his change, they notice something up ahead.
DOWN AGAIN. This time the Cadillac is PARKED SIDEWAYS ACR
HARRY
I think this guy's in trouble. Why on't you pull over. Lloyd looks at Harry. Harry remembers that he's driving. pulls the car to the side of the road. Mental approaches passenger window.
MENTAL
You guys going as far as Des Moines? My car died and I'm late for a business meeting.
They're back on the highway and Joe Mental is SITTING BET THEM, looking extremely ANNOYED. The guys are in the midd of an argument. HARRY
It's a fruit. LLOYD
It's a vegetable. HARRY
I'm telling you, it's a fruit. LLOYD
And I happen to know it's a vegetable. HARRY
Tell you what, why don't we leet an impartial judge decide. LLOYD
Fine with me. Harry turns to Joe Mental. HARRY

Hey, Mr. Mentalino, settle our bet: Are jelly beans fruits or vegetables? Mental grits his teeth as he pops a few antacid pills in mouth. He reaches into his coat pocket and we see a GLINT STEEL. Just when he's about to pull the gun out, though, Lloyd hits the breaks and SKIDS to a stop beside a bunch hitchhiking MIGRANT WORKERS.

The trio have picked up SIX MIGRANT WORKERS and everyone crammed into the car including a CRYING BABY who sits on pissed-off Mental's lap. Someone's playing a FLAMENCO GUI and the gang is SINGING a SPANISH SONG.
The Migrant Family is gone now. Harry and Lloyd are playi a game while Mental stares straight ahead, furious. His e are watering and he looks ill. LLOYD
Okay, Harry, my turn. Let 'er rip. Harry lifts a cheer and lets out a LOUD FART. Lloyd SNIFF few times, then closes his eyes and WAFTS it up toward hi nostrils, as if it was the aroma of a fine wine.

Hmmm... full-bodied, delicate bouquet, aged to perfection will rip no fart before it's time. (beat) Come on, Marquis of Dingleberry's rules: you got ten seconds. All right. I'll say: cheese doodles, chili dog extra onions, garden salad with blue...
And...?
Kit-Kat bar. Harry throws up his arms, defeated. He hands Lloyd a buck HARRY
You're the best, man. (beat) Okay, my turn. LLOYD
Where are your manners, Harry? We have a guest. Harry punches Mental's shoulder playfully. HARRY
Come on, Mr. Mentalino. Let one fly. It's only a buck.
A large neon road sign beside the cafe shows a man's exasperated face with FLAMES SHOOTING FROM HIS NOSE, MOUT AND EARS. The sign advertises: HOTTEST CHILI
Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a table with a hateful Joe Mental. The boys are each holding up a POINTED RED CHILI PEPPER. HARRY
I'll do one if you will. LLOYD
Okay, you go first. HARRY
No, you go first. LLOYD
No, you go first. MENTAL
Why don't you both stop being a couple of pussies and go at the same time. It ain't that hot. Lloyd and Harry exchange a look, then simultaneously BITE INTO THE PEPPERS. LLOYD
Hmmm, not bad... HARRY
Yeah, more tingly than hot. Suddenly the boys' EYES LIGHT UP. THEY LET OUT A SHRIEK. smile begins to curl on Mental's lips. He pours them a co glasses of water from a pitcher. MENTAL
Have some water. It'll help. Lloyd and Harry who are both sweating profusely now start to GULP down their water. This, of course, makes it burn more. MENTAL (CONT'D)
Aw, shucks, that's right. Water just makes it worse... The boys run to the bar and DUMP PITCHERS OF WATER ON THE HEADS, much to the elight of a CHUCKLING Joe Mental.
Mental is on the phone outside the front door TALKING to Nicholas Andre.
MENTAL
It's Mental. I'm just sitting down to a nice meal with our boys. ANDRE
Good work. What did you find out so far? MENTAL
Nothing yet, but I'm gonna shake 'em own for information at lunch. (beat) Then I'm gonna kill 'em for dessert. ANDRE
Well eat fast, time's running out. And whatever you do, don't let them get any closer. I don need them here running around Aspen. Mental pulls a BLACK VIAL OF PILLS out of his jacket. MENTAL
Relax, they ain't gonna be running around anywhere after I dump a little cyanide in their pops.
Back at the table, the boys are soaked and HUFFING as if they just finished the Boston Marathon. The burgers have been served, but Lloyd and Harry are still too traumatize to touch them. HARRY
That really wasn't very polite of him, was it? Maybe we should loosen the screws of his chair. LLOYD
Harry Dunne, I'm surprised at you. Perhaps it's about time you brushed

head_text.subj: UP ON A LITTLE TOME THAT WE GOD-

text: fearing adults call the Bible. It's crammed with all kind of pithy rules to live your life by.
HARRY
(humbled) You mean like 'turn the other cheek?' LLOYD
No, I mean like 'an eye for an eye.' Hand me those peppers the atomic ones. Harry passes the jar and the two of them LOAD JOE MENTAL'

head_text.subj: PEPPERS, EXPERTLY CAMOUFLAGING THEM WITH LETTUCE.

text: HARRY
(whispering) Here he comes. Lloyd and Harry bite into their food as Joe Mental sits b down at the table. MENTAL

Feeling any better, boys? As he pours ketchup on his burger, the guys glance at eac other and TITTER. Then he picks it up and brings it to hi mouth. Just before biting into it, though, he PAUSES. MENTAL (CONT'D)
So tell me, why you fellas headed to Aspen? Vacation? LLOYD
More like re-location. Mental starts toward the burger but stops again. MENTAL
Doesn't look like you packed much. All I saw was a couple bags... and that briefcase. HARRY
The briefcase isn't even ours. Some lady just left it at the airport. We're bringing it back to her. This is news to Mental. MENTAL
You mean you don't even know her? LLOYD
Not really. I was just her limo river.
Mental looks at the two of them and realizes that they're serious. Then he BREAKS OUT LAUGHING.

Talk about being in the wrong place at the wrong time... Lloyd and Harry share a     confused look. Mental shakes head and BITES INTO HIS     BURGER, CHEWING HEARTILY. Alm immediately, his happy     demeanor is replaced by a LOOK HORROR. His FACE TURNS     RED, HE GRABS HIS STOMACH AND
The boys look at each other guiltily, then bend down to h him.
Hey, you okay, man? It was just a goof.
(STRAINED WHISPER)

My ulcer... quick... pills... in my coat... Harry checks Mental's coat pocket        for his antacid unwittingly brings out the BLACK        OF CYANIDE PILLS. some pills out and hands them to        Mental, who tosse his mouth and starts to MUNCH on        them. For a moment, he appears to improve. His BREATHING SLOWS he sits up. Then his EYES LIGHT UP. MENTAL'S POV - QUICK ZOOM IN on the black bottle Harry is holding!
You son-of-a-bitch! Mental GURGLES and keels over, DEAD.
Lloyd and Harry are back on the road, looking solemn.
I can't believe it...
LLOYD
Life is a fragile thing, Har. One minute you're chewing on a burger; the next minute you're dead meat. HARRY
But he blamed me. You heard him. Those were his last words. LLOYD
If you don't count that gurgling sound. Harry lets out a GROAN. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Hey, relax, man, I'm just as responsible as you are we both slipped him the peppers and look at me, I on't feel guilty at all. HARRY
Small comfort coming from a man who sells dead birds to blind kids. (SIGHS)
Don't you get it, Lloyd. I've got a ead guy pissed at me. His restless spirit will probably haunt me for the next seventy-five years. LLOYD
That's ridiculous. You probably won't live to see forty. Harry perks up, cheered by this thought. HARRY
Oh yeah. (beat) Wow. What a relief.
As the Mutt Cutts van flashes by on it's westward journey we
A DOCTOR is covering up the body of Joe Mental as he TALK to DETECTIVE DALE. The etective is a no-nonsense type in mid-forties with a military-regulation crewcut.
...My official conclusion is that the eceased expired from oxygen eprivation caused by the presence of cyanide in the bloodstream. DT. DALE
You mean he was poisoned? DOCTOR
Unquestionably. We found these by the body. He holds up the container of cyanide pills. Dt. Dale nods and approaches another COP in the b.g. COP
Waitress says he was with a couple of younger guys. They're the ones who called the ambulance then they hit the road. DT. DALE
Any idea where they were going? COP
A witness at the next table thought he heard them say they were driving to France. Dale frowns at this and the Cop shrugs. COP (CONT'D)
We got a report they were seen heading west on I-80 toward Colorado. DT. DALE
Get a make on the vehicle? The Cop consults his note pad. COP
Yes, sir. They were driving an '84 poodle. Dt. Dale does a double-take.
An '84 what?
COP
(straight-faced) Well it might have been a wire-haired terrier, Detective. They're very similar in appearance. The Detective looks confused, as we
The boys are extremely exhausted as they plow through the black night toward Aspen. HARRY
Let's get off and crash at a motel before I crash into one. (yawning) I need a crib fast. LLOYD
Sorry, Har. We're gonna have to hold out. Seems we misjudged our expense allocation. If we pay for a motel we won't have enough for gas. HARRY
What happened to the dough? LLOYD
We over-leveraged.
On what? LLOYD
I sprung for Mr. Chili Pepper's last meal. Felt it was the least we could o after we deep-sixed him. HARRY
Wait a second one burger put us over budget? LLOYD
The slob ordered a double-bacon eluxe and a chocolate malt.
Oh. (beat) So what are we gonna do?
LLOYD
Drive. We've only got ten more hours. We can take turns.
A frightened J.P. Shay is TALKING on the phone with Nicho Andre. SHAY
You heard me, he's dead. The bastards killed him.
Andre nervously lights a cigarette as he speaks. ANDRE
Jesus Christ... Andre's forehead begins to glisten with perspiration. ANDRE (CONT'D)
All right, I want you back here now. If they're coming this way I'm going to need you. SHAY
(v.o.) How's our bankroll doing? Giving you a hard time? ANDRE
Melvin's not the problem. It's these two other guys that have me worried. I wish I knew what the hell they wanted. Andre hangs up the phone and then disappears down his bas stairs.
The room has a dirt floor. There's a stone WELL in the mi We hear MUFFLED HUMAN WHIMPERING coming from deep within well. Andre walks to the edge of the dark hole. ANDRE
How you doing today, Melvin?
Andre takes a hit off his cigarette and flicks it into th well.
The Mutt Cutts van cruises down the lonely interstate.

Lloyd is now FAST ASLEEP in the passenger seat as Harry d on. A roadsign reading DENVER - 602 MILES whizzes by. Tod Rundgren's "Too Far Gone" begins to play while Harry peer at the empty highway INTROSPECTIVELY. As the song plays w see a series of quick shots: A new sign says DENVER - 421 MILES. Lloyd is still asleep with his feet now on Harry's lap. Another sign reads DENVER - 201 MILES. Harry stares strai ahead, practically catatonic. Lloyd's feet are out the wi and his head is on Harry's lap. The next roadsign says DENVER - 157 MILES. Lloyd's feet a now up over the headrest and his head is down where his f should be. Harry looks on the verge of blacking out. Finally, a sign reads COLORADO STATE LINE - 25 MILES/FOOD GAS NEXT EXIT.

The Mutt Cutts van pulls up to a gas pump. In the backgro are several tractor-trailer rigs and a cafe. Harry climbs out, thoroughly exhausted, walks around and opens the passenger door. Lloyd tumbles to the asphalt, STILL ASLEEP. Harry nudges with his foot. HARRY
Come on, wake up. You pay, I'll pump. Lloyd comes to and grudgingly pulls himself up to his fee
Harry moves to the back of the poodle van. He has to LIFT ONE OF THE CAR'S REAR LEGS to unscrew the gas cap. Then h sticks the nozzle in and starts to fill her up.

Lloyd comes around the   corner, dragging a BATHROOM KEY ATTACHED BY A CHAIN TO   A CAR ENGINE toward the Men's Ro When he gets it to the   door, he struggles to lift the e on it's side, finally   managing to slip the key into the

Harry is yawning as he pumps the gas. Suddenly a Jeep Che pulls up and a long-legged, tanned, ATHLETIC BEAUTY climb out. This seems to wake Harry up. The Athletic Beauty   smiles at Harry as she grabs a pump starts to fill her   jeep. Harry makes a feeble attempt t brush his hair into   place, then CLEARS HIS THROAT and n to the skis on her   roof-rack.
Skis, huh? ATHLETIC BEAUTY
That's right.
Great. She continues to pump gas.
They yours?
Uh-huh..
Both of 'em?
Um, yeah. HARRY
(impressed) Cool.

head_text.subj: THE GAS FROM HARRY'S NOZZLE STARTS TO OVERFLOW, BUT HE DO

text: like a BIG DOG IS PISSING ON HIS LEG. ATHLETIC BEAUTY
Excuse me, you're spraying everywhere.
Harry turns to see the gas GUSHING ALL OVER HIS SHOES. He immediately removes the nozzle and replaces it on the pum as she smiles to herself.

Lloyd is standing in a stall urinating. He starts to read the graffiti scrawled on the wall. Finally, he comes to o that says: FOR A GOOD TIME, MEET ME HERE NOVEMBER 8, 1993 2:15 A.M. SHARP. He frowns at this, then looks nervously at his watch. CLOSE UP OF DIAL - the date reads NOVEMBER 8. ZOOM IN on the minute hand as it CLICKS TO EXACTLY 2:15. Just as a concerned look crosses Lloyd's face, we hear th BATHROOM DOOR SQUEAK OPEN AND SLAM SHUT! Terrified, Lloyd quickly locks the stall door, then crouches on the toilet bowl so his feet aren't visible. The sound of HEAVY FOOTS approaches the stall and then stops. Lloyd looks down to a pair of SIZE 16 WORKBOOTS beneath the door. We can bare hear a LOW GROWL. Then the stall handle JIGGLES. Lloyd ho his breath. The ominous boots MOVE AWAY and Lloyd lets ou SIGH OF RELIEF. All of a sudden the DOOR IS KICKED IN, AND A TOWERING FIG STEPS INTO FRAME. Lloyd looks up and GASPS. HIS POV - it's the Redneck trucker, Sea Bass. SEA BASS
Well, well, well, if it ain't my old friend. (checks watch) And right on time... As Sea Bass STEPS INTO THE STALL, we
The Athletic Beauty is back in her Jeep now and Harry has sidled up to the driver's side. He leans against her side view mirror.
HARRY
(re: suitcases in back seat) That's a lot of luggage for a little vacation. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

Actually, I'm moving to Aspen. I've got to get away from my boyfriend. He's such a klutz. My astrologer told me I should avoid accident-prone guys. Just then, the side-view mirror Harry has been leaning on

head_text.subj: SNAPS OFF THE CAR. HE CRACKS
HIS HEAD AGAINST THE WINDSHIELD, FALLS TO THE GROUND, THE
QUICKLY LEAPS TO HIS FEET AS IF NOTHING HAPPENED.

text: HARRY
(holding out mirror) Here, this is a little loose. She throws the mirror into the back seat and takes out a cigarette.

Allow me... He pulls out a match and lights it with a debonair flouri The Athletic Beauty nods her thanks. Harry tosses the mat to the ground, and we hear an O.S. WHOOSH! Wisps of smoke rise around him and we hear the LOW CRACKLE OF SOMETHING BURNING. (Neither of them notice this.) HARRY (CONT'D)
Look, um, maybe when I get to Aspen we can meet up... you know, for hot chocolate or something. She looks him over and smiles. ATHLETIC BEAUTY

Why not? You seem pretty harmless. I'll give you my number. Just let me find a pen. As she starts to rummage through her purse, Harry SMELLS SMOKE. He looks down and sees that his RIGHT SHOE IS ABLA He shakes it, then tries to put it out with the other sho but to no avail. Meanwhile, the Athletic Beauty is still searching for a pen.
ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)
I know I have one here somewhere... Harry starts doing a soft-shoe dance to extinguish the fl This only helps to fan them. HARRY
(urgently) Look, why don't you just tell it to me, I've got a good memory. ATHLETIC BEAUTY
Are you sure you won't forget? HARRY
(desperate) Positive please hurry. He begins hopping around violently. ATHLETIC BEAUTY
Is something wrong? Harry shakes his head no as he bites his lip to keep from screaming. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)

Okay, my number is 652-2553. (beat) Oh, wait a second, that's my old number. It's so funny how your mind god sakes, give me the damn number! She's taken aback by this outburst. ATHLETIC BEAUTY (CONT'D)
Look, man, if you're gonna get pushy you can just forget it! She throws the car into drive and PEELS AWAY.
Sea Bass has his meaty paw wrapped around Lloyd's neck as slides him up the wall of the toilet stall. SEA BASS
First I'm gonna rape you, then I'm gonna kill you. Any last request? LLOYD
Um, yeah could you do it the other way around?

Sea Bass pushes Lloyd to his knees. Then the trucker step back and UNDOES HIS FLY. The sound of the zipper brings a green color to Lloyd's face. ON THE MEN'S ROOM DOOR - it bursts open and a FLAME-FOOTE Harry rushes into the bathroom, panic-stricken. In his desperation he PLOWS THROUGH THE STALL DOOR KNOCKING SEA BASS ON THE HEAD and thrusts his flaming foot into the toilet, EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE. Harry breathes a DEEP SIGH of relief. Only then does he n
Harry has to do a DOUBLE-TAKE for this to sink in. Then h lets out an admonishing WHISTLE. HARRY
You've got some serious explaining to o, young man.
CLOSE UP - of Harry's BURNT SHOE     with the toes sticki on the accelerator.
Look, Harry, I told you what happened, now drop it. HARRY
Sure thing, Lloyd. I promise not to mention another word about you being in a bathroom stall with a six-foot, five-inch trucker with his pants own. LLOYD
That's a low blow, man. HARRY
Not at that height it's not. LLOYD
Listen, bud, if you're trying to imply that I'm that thought look, we're almost in Colorado.

head_text.subj: LLOYD SQUINTS THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD. A SIGN UP AHEAD SAY

text: HARRY
I think it's about   time we pull over and change seats.   I've been driving for nine straight   hours I  don't have the energy to   start a new state. Lloyd nods, and as he pulls off the exit, we

CLOSE ON A SIGN - it reads WELCOME  TO COLORADO, HOME OF ROCKY MOUNTAINS. PAN DOWN to reveal  a number of POLICEME stopping and checking cars as they  cross the border. A HELICOPTER lands on the side of the  road and Detective D hops out. He hurries to the COP in  charge. DT. DALE
Any sign of them yet? COP
No, but we're expecting them shortly. A motorist said he spotted a pooch about thirty miles back headed this way. Detective Dale nods, satisfied.
ESTABLISHING SHOT of a mini mart.
The door opens and Lloyd gets in carrying a bag of Dorito and a soda. He settles into the driver's seat and pulls a Beef Jerky out of his back pocket. LLOYD
Hey, I picked you up a Beef Jerky... When he gets no response, he notices that Harry is alread fast asleep in the passenger seat. Lloyd shakes his head. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Boy, some guys just weren't cut out for life on the road.

Lloyd starts the engine and    pulls out of the parking l the nearby freeway entrance.    As he enters the on-ramp, ZOOM IN on a sign that says:    ROUTE 80 - EAST. He's unw headed BACK IN THE DIRECTION    THEY JUST CAME FROM!
It's bright daylight now. Harry is sleeping peacefully in the passenger seat while Lloyd sips a coffee. The van hit bump which causes Harry's eyes to flutter open. LLOYD
Hey, Mr. Sleepy Head, welcome back. HARRY
(groggy) How long have I been out? LLOYD
I'd say a good five hours, anyway. Harry yawns and stretches. HARRY
Great. We must be getting real close, huh? LLOYD
Should be. I've been averaging about ninety miles an hour all night. HARRY
Good man. LLOYD
Boy, I'll tell you, this is one angerous highway. You wouldn't believe all the road pizza two dead ogs, a couple of rabbits, a snake and some big thing I couldn't even recognize. HARRY
That's awful. Did you see them get hit or were they already lying there? LLOYD
I hit 'em. Harry rubs his eyes and looks at the passing FLATLANDS.
HARRY
Funny. I expected the Rocky Mountains to be a little rockier than this. LLOYD
I was thinking the same thing. That John Denver's some full of shit, huh? They both stare out the window. LLOYD (CONT'D)
I must say, Des Moines sure is a pretty little town. HARRY
Yeah, it really is. (beat) Wait a minute when did you visit Des Moines? LLOYD
Last night. We drove through it. HARRY
What are you talking about? You were snoring like a baby when we went through Des Moines. Lloyd shakes his head in amusement, then SNAPS HIS FINGER in Harry's face. LLOYD
(sing-song) Hello? Hello? Anybody home? Rise and shine. (LAUGHS)

You were the one who was asleep, numbskull. Here, take a sip of coffee. You're delirious. A confused Harry sips the coffee and checks out the passi terrain. Then something starts to awn on him. Slowly. HARRY
Uh, Lloyd, refresh my memory: Doesn't the sun rise in the east and set in the west? LLOYD
In our country it does, yes.
HARRY
Then perchance you can explain to me why the sun is in our face at 7:30 in the morning when we're heading west. Lloyd thinks about this and then looks SICKENED.
The Mutt Cutts van is parked next to a couple rigs and Ha is sitting beside it on the pavement, a BROKEN man. LLOYD
I'm only human, Harry. Anybody can make a mistake. But Harry just sits there, practically catatonic. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Come on, man, pull yourself together. HARRY
You know, I got half a mind to just jump on the bus to Europe and say goodbye to your ugly mug forever. LLOYD
(rolls his eyes) You can't take a bus to Europe, dodo. HARRY
Oh yeah? Why not? LLOYD
You don't have a passport. Harry lets out a defeated SIGH. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Come on, stop being a baby about this. Okay, so we back-tracked a tad. HARRY

A tad? Lloyd, you drove almost a sixth of the way across the country in the wrong direction. Now we don't have enough money to get to Aspen, we on't have enough money to get home, we don't have enough to eat, we don't have enough to sleep!
LLOYD
Well it doesn't do any good having you sitting there on your butt whining about it. If we're gonna get out of this hole, we're gonna have to dig ourselves out. Harry thinks about this. HARRY
You know, you're absolutely right, Lloyd. He stands up, brushes off his pants, and starts to walk t the highway. LLOYD
Where you going? HARRY
Home. I'm walking home. LLOYD
You can't be serious. HARRY
(sarcastic) Why not? We're probably only five miles away. Harry starts resolutely toward the road while Lloyd watch LLOYD (CALLING OUT)
Thanks a lot, Mr. Perfect. Like you never screwed up. Harry suddenly STOPS IN HIS TRACKS and turns back to his friend. He seems completely rained.

Look, man... I'm sorry. (beat) I never should have let you talk me into this in the first place. You've got a good reason to goo a beautiful girl's waiting for you. But let's face it, Lloyd, there's nothing waiting for me in Aspen. (beat) There's nothing waiting for me anywhere.
Lloyd just stands there, SPEECHLESS, as Harry turns and w away. Out of frustration, he BANGS the snout of the car, causing it to BARK.

Harry is walking down the highway, his thumb stuck out unenthusiastically. A few cars WHIZ by, the cold wind whi at his clothes. A station wagon blows by and throws a BAG  OF GARBAGE out window. It lands at Harry's feet. EXTREME  CLOSE-UP OF HA FACE - a TEAR slowly rolls down his cheek  (like the Indi in the commercial). PAN DOWN to the bag of  garbage. We s it's a BAG OF ONIONS that's ripped open. Suddenly a HEARSE pulls up and stops. It's an ominous-loo vehicle and Harry hesitates. Then the passenger window ro down, revealing a contrite Lloyd at the wheel. LLOYD
Got room for one more, if you still want to go to Aspen. Harry looks the hearse over. HARRY
Where'd you find this baby? LLOYD
Used car dealer. I   traded the van for it. Plus I got   the guy to throw in fifty bucks for   gas money. (beat) Come on, man, what   do you say? We still partners?
An impatient Detective Dale is still staked-out at the Colorado border with several other officers. DT. DALE
It doesn't make sense. They should've been here hours ago. COP
Maybe they're smarter than we thought.
DT. DALE
How smart can they be? They're riving a goddamn dog! Another COP rushes over holding his walkie-talkie. COP #2
We just got a report that they were spotted about two hours ago heading east near Des Moines on I-80. DT. DALE
(incredulous) Des Moines?! Why that's five hundred miles from here! COP #1
Guess they got wind of our welcoming party. DT. DALE
We're wasting time. Let's mobilize. Dt. Dale heads for his cruiser while the other Cops follo As the officers climb into their cars, we
Lloyd is driving and Harry has his feet out the window. LLOYD
Tell me something, Harry. Would you really have kept going home if I hadn't come back to get you? HARRY

Well let me put it this way, Lloyd: Do you remember when we were Cub Scouts and we got lost in the woods uring that blizzard? We huddled together all night, and we made an oath that if we ever got out of there alive we'd never ever leave each other's side again. Do you remember that? Lloyd thinks hard about this. LLOYD
We were never Cub Scouts.
HARRY

Exactly. Just then several COP CARS whiz by them in the opposite direction with SIRENS BLARING and LIGHTS FLASHING. When H glances back at the cop cars, he notices that there's a C in the rear of the vehicle. HARRY (CONT'D)
What the hell is this? There's a coffin in the back! LLOYD
Relax, it's empty. HARRY
I don't give a shit. I'm not driving anywhere with a casket. You know I'm superstitious calm down. We'll dump it off first chance we get.
Harry and Lloyd are swerving through traffic in the hears Ahead of them is a REAL FUNERAL PROCESSION. The lead car a CADILLAC.
(This is the car right behind the funeral hearse.) A MAN a WOMAN are arguing. WOMAN
I married a cheapskate. MAN
Shut your trap, Gerdie. WOMAN
I'm so embarrassed. I'll never be able to show my face again. MAN
I knew something good would come out of this. WOMAN
We could have given him a more ignified burial.
MAN
Your uncle was a cheap man. Remember what he got us for our twenty-fifth? A friggin' fern. There's no way I'm gonna spend a load to get him planted.
While the couple ARGUES ON, Harry and Lloyd cut in front them. The Man and the Woman on't notice this an soon the

Harry and Lloyd pull up to a large green dumpster behind market. The procession comes to a halt behind them. The g get out of the hearse and remove the coffin from the back Then they unceremoniously HEAVE THE COFFIN INTO THE DUMPS
ON THE LEAD CAR OF THE PROCESSION - The Woman's jaw is practically on the floor. WOMAN
You son-of-a-bitch! I want a ivorce!

head_text.subj: THE HEARSE WEAVING IT'S WAY THROUGH THE
SCENIC ROCKIES AS WE REPRISE 'MARY'S PRAYER' BY DANNY WIL

text: The hearse drives past a sign that says ENTERING ASPEN, COLORADO.
The boys stroll down the sidewalk, looking in the windows studying the passersby, taking in the sights and sounds o the ski town.
LLOYD
Isn't this wonderful? What more could a couple of single guys like us ask for? HARRY
How about food and shelter? LLOYD
You're so materialistic. (beat) Why don't we get down to business and eliver the briefcase to Mary. Who knows, maybe she'll invite us in for tea and a strumpet or two? HARRY
Jolly good idea, chap. And where oes the lovely young lady reside?
Um... good question. Harry throws Lloyd a concerned look, but then notices a p booth next to them. HARRY
Well what's her last name? We'll look it up in the phone book.
Hmmmm... You know, I don't believe I caught that either. Harry's concern grows. HARRY
What about the briefcase, Lloyd? There must've been a name on it, right? LLOYD
(brightening) Come to think of it, there is. It's engraved right into the leather.
What is it? LLOYD
Samsonite   spelled just like it sounds.
Harry starts flipping through the phone book. Then abrupt HE STOPS and puts the book down, a DEFEATED look on his f

The car is parked in a parking lot across the street from picturesque bridge. Harry and Lloyd are shivering in the front seat as a LOUD, ICY WIND WHIPS though the hearse. They're each spooning something out of a coffee cup and sipping it. HARRY
Any soup left? LLOYD
A little. Shall we share it? HARRY
Please. Lloyd opens a TINY KETCHUP PACKET and squirts half of it into Harry's cup and the other half into his. They pour a few drops of water in and mix it with their spoons. LLOYD
Mmmm mmmm good... Lloyd smiles bravely at Harry. Harry notices something an leans toward him. HARRY
Hey, you got something stuck in your front teeth. Lloyd picks a small speck out of his mouth and studies it
Hmmm... looks like an old piece of Beef Jerky.
HARRY
Wanna split it? LLOYD
You're pathetic. Get your own. Loyd puts the floss-meat back in his mouth and chews it. Another gust of wind swirls around them.
HARRY
I'm freezing my ass off, Lloyd. LLOYD
Roll up your window. HARRY
It is rolled up. LLOYD
Then I guess the damn anti-cold system isn't working. You really should get it fixed if we're gonna live here all winter. HARRY
What anti-cold system? Lloyd points to the dash. LLOYD

Right here the A/C button. I put it on full blast about an hour ago and, if anything, the car's getting colder. Harry stares at Lloyd and then throws down his cup, disgu He opens the car door and starts to climb out. LLOYD (CONT'D)
What are you going out there for?
To warm up.
Harry gets out and leans against the car with his arms crossed. Lloyd comes from around the other side. LLOYD
What are you worrying about now? HARRY
I'm worried about how you're gonna survive the pummeling I'm about to give you.
Huh? Suddenly Harry LUNGES at Lloyd, who takes off around the other side of the car. Harry leaps across the hood, but L manages to evade his grasp.
LLOYD (CONT'D)
Harry, calm down! You're acting like a wild animal! HARRY
Get over here and take your medicine, Lloyd! LLOYD
Sorry, doc, I can't take medicine. I'm a Christian Scientist! Lloyd continues to outrun him around the car. Frustrated, Harry opens the car and PULLS THE BRIEFCASE OUT. LLOYD (CONT'D)
What are you doing? HARRY
Something I should've done a long time ago. This stupid thing has been the root of our problems all along. Harry starts walking toward the bridge spanning a river. LLOYD
Don't do anything foolish, Harry. HARRY
Foolish? This is the most sensible thing I've done in years. I'm gonna toss this goddamn curse right into that river. Lloyd starts to follow after Harry. LLOYD
You're making a big mistake, Harry! I'll never forgive you for this! Harry keeps marching toward the bridge, determined to dis of the briefcase. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Harry, hold up! Things are gonna get better, I promise! In fact, I think I feel another piece of Beef Jerky in my left molar! It's yours, Harry, all yours! Harry stops in his tracks, intrigued.
HARRY
You're bluffing. LLOYD
No I'm not, man look. Lloyd pulls his cheek back, revealing a molar. Harry squi at it. HARRY

That's a filling, you liar! Just then, Lloyd makes a dash at Harry. Harry turns and r but Lloyd TACKLES HIM as they reach the bridge. The brief GOES FLYING, and the guys wrestle pitifully with one anot in the snow, rolling over and over. Finally, Harry manages to get the upper hand. He climbs o top and CLASPS HIS HANDS AROUND LLOYD'S THROAT. HARRY (CONT'D)
I used to have a life! A miserable one, but a life, nonetheless! Suddenly Lloyd's EYES LIGHT UP as he sees something O.S. behind his friend. LLOYD (CHOKED VOICE)
Harry, look! Harry turns and HIS EYES LIGHT UP, TOO. He lets go of Llo as we see

head_text.subj: THE BRIEFCASE IS LYING BUSTED OPEN ON THE GRO
STACKS OF BIG, BEAUTIFUL HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS

text: Harry and Lloyd are hurrying down the sidewalk, clutching the briefcase. The city is lit up with millions of tiny lights, like a fantasy winter wonderland. LLOYD
Okay, here's the plan: We borrow a few bucks just a small loan from the briefcase, and we check into a cheap motel.
Sounds good. LLOYD
And we'll keep track of the money we spend with IOUs. HARRY
We'll be meticulous    right down to the last penny. LLOYD
That way, whatever we borrow we can pay back. HARRY
Absolutely. We're good for it. LLOYD
You know, as soon as we get jobs. HARRY
It'll come right out of our first paycheck.
A tuxedoed Bell Captain, BARNARD, is showing the guys aro an ENORMOUS AND LUXURIOUS SUITE. The place is big enough throw a touchdown bomb in.

...This is the Hotel Danbury's Presidential Suite, gentlemen. It's normally reserved for royalty, visiting dignitaries, and illustrious stars of stage and take it. The Bell Captain is a bit taken aback, but pleased. BARNARD (CONT'D)
Very good, sir. Are there any bags you'd like sent up? LLOYD
Thanks, Barnard, but we'll find our own chicks. BARNARD
(peevish) I wasn't talking about ladies.
Oh. Then go ahead and send thim up. What are their names? Barnard SIGHS.
Sir, I meant your luggage. Harry forces a. embarrassed half-smile.
Tell you what you can send up, my friend how about some chow? The Bell Captain nods.
I'll bring you a menu.
Don't bother. Just order us one of everything. At this, Harry serves Lloyd a reproachful look.
One of everything? Lloyd... Lloyd looks guilty.
Oh, sorry. (beat) Make that two of everything. Harry smiles at this as Lloyd pulls a wad of HUNDRED DOLL BILLS out of his pocket. He rips one off and tucks it in Barnard's top pocket.
And here you go, Barney. You keep us happy, we'll keep you happy. The Bell Captain, Barnard, is energized by this tip.
Yes, sir! He bows and leaves the room. Then Lloyd cracks open the briefcase and inserts a SMALL PIECE OF PAPER.
(proudly) Our first IOU. Signed and dated.
Helen Swanson is KNOCKING on her step-daughter's bedroom door. She's holding a tray with a couple of mugs on it.
Mary? You awake?
(o.s.) COME IN...
Mary is sitting in a chair looking sadly out the French windows when Helen ENTERS.
I brought you some tea. I thought it might help you relax. Mary smiles.
Thank you. She takes a mug, sips, and pulls back.
Yech! What's in this, whiskey?
Uh, sorry... that one's mine. Helen grabs the mug from Mary and hands her the other one
Feeling any better, honey? Mary can't take her eyes from the window.
Just knowing that Melvin's out there, being held by God knows who... (fighting back tears) It's all my fault. I should've been there.
HELEN
Bullshit. You can't blame yourself for this. If you'd been there they would've taken you, too. Helen pulls out a joint and torches it up. She takes a hi MARY
Maybe we should just pay them the money again and get this thing over with. HELEN
Now Mary, everything that can be done is being done. You've got to stop torturing yourself. MARY
What am I supposed to do? Go about my life as if everything were fine?

That's exactly what you should do. Get the hell out more, go skiing, socialize. Don't you see, honey? We can't let on that anything is wrong. If the press or authorities get wind of this, the kidnappers might panic. (beat) Who knows what they'd do to poor Melvin then?

head_text.subj: AS MARY THINKS ABOUT THIS, WE

text: The Guys pull up to the front of the hotel in the hearse. Several HOTEL EMPLOYEES rush to help them. Harry and Lloy get out wearing OVERLY TRENDY SKI GARB, complete with fur boots, NASA designed goggles, and splashy fluorescent col everywhere. The Employees all grab the shopping bags and then line up as Lloyd TIPS THEM ALL handsomely.
The huge beds are covered in boxes and bags of new goodie Lloyd is going through it all. Harry is sitting out on th balcony with his feet up on the railing, checking out the mountain view.
HARRY
Oh god, it's really true. Last night I thought I might've been dreaming. LLOYD
It's no dream, Har. We finally cracked the big time. HARRY
And it was so simple. All it took was somebody else's money. Harry LIGHTS A CIGAR WITH A TWENTY DOLLAR BILL, takes a h puff, and EXHALES. HARRY (CONT'D)
You know, Lloyd, I think you might've gone a little overboard with the spending today. He blows out the twenty and tosses it off the balcony. LLOYD
What's the big deal? We're gonna pay it all back anyway, right? HARRY
Sure, but do you really think you needed to buy those two surfboards? LLOYD
Surfboards? I thought those were beginner's skis. This suddenly makes sense to Harry. HARRY
Ahhh. I was wondering why you had those bindings put on them. Lloyd opens a box and holds up a SCANTY NEGLIGEE. LLOYD
Where'd this come from?
(sheepishly) I bought it. LLOYD
What for?
I like the feel of it against my skin... (defensive) ...I mean, you know, when a woman's wearing it. Lloyd inspects it more closely. LLOYD
Harry, how many women do you know who wear a size XXL? HARRY
Look, leave me alone. I'm rich now. I'm supposed to have a few eccentricities. There's a KNOCK on the door. LLOYD
Enter, parlez vous! The Bell Captain, Barnard, ENTERS with a champagne bucket and a newspaper under his arm. BARNARD
I brought you your newspaper and some champagne, gentlemen. Unfortunately, we didn't seem to have the, um, label you requested. Lloyd examines the champagne's label and frowns. LLOYD
All out of Boone's Farm, huh? BARNARD
You have a rapier wit, sir. I took the liberty of bringing a comparable substitute: Dom Perignon. LLOYD
Guess it'll have to do, slugger, eh? Lloyd smiles and over tips him. BARNARD
Thank you so much, sir. He puts the tray down, hands Lloyd the newspaper, and hea for the door.
LLOYD

Oh, one more thing: You can     dispense with the 'sir' crap. Let's     face it, Barney, we're all from the     same mold. (winks) We just have a little more     dough than you right now. Barnard smiles and EXITS. Harry comes back in the room. H picks up a champagne glass and flicks it with his finger, sending out a resonant RING. HARRY
Cocktail hour has commenced! He starts to open the champagne bottle as Lloyd begins thumbing through the newspaper. HARRY (CONT'D)
Hey, later on what do you say we...? He notices that Lloyd's mouth has dropped open at somethi he's found in the paper.
Lloyd... you okay? LLOYD
(dumbstruck) Harry, it's her. HARRY
Who? LLOYD

Mary with the briefcase. This is her... He shoves the newspaper at Harry. CLOSE ON THE HEADLINE - it reads: SWANSONS TO HOST PRESERVATION GALA TONIGHT; CITY'S ELITE EXPECTED. Underne this is a photograph of Mary with her parents. LLOYD (CONT'D)
Mary Swanson... HARRY
Come on, Cinderella, it's time to get you ready for the ball... Roy Orbison's "Pretty Woman" plays over a...

-The boys are in a beauty parlor getting their hair shamp -Harry and Lloyd sit beneath old-fashioned hair dryers. T ATTENDANTS lift the dryers from their heads, revealing bo guys' hair in curlers. -Lloyd's getting shaved by an ATTENDANT with a straight-r Suddenly Lloyd grabs his neck as if he's been nicked. BLOOD SQUIRTS OUT from between hi fingers. The other CUSTOMERS stare in horror at this. Llo LAUGHS and shows everyone a SQUEEZE KETCHUP BOTTLE hidden his hand. Only Harry and Lloyd seem to find this joke amu -We see them getting their nose hairs clipped. PAN DOWN t the floor to reveal a PILE OF NOSE HAIR CLIPPINGS. -Then a   shot of a MAN next to them getting a pedicure. OVER to   Lloyd's bare feet  he has toe nails like Howard Hughes.   Sparks are flying as an ATTENDANT wearing safet goggles   tries to sand down Lloyd's toenails with an ele sander. -Harry is lying on his stomach with his shirt off, gettin massage from a beautiful ORIENTAL MASSEUSE. He pulls a hu dollar bill from under his towel, hands it to her, and WHISPERS in her ear.
